title: Jessica Mauboy speaks about the moment her construction worker fiance proposed to her in Greece
text:
Jessica Mauboy has spoken about the tender moment her long-time boyfriend proposed to her.

The beloved Australian singer announced her engagement on Thursday, after her now fiance Themeli Magripilis got down on one knee in Greece during a stunning sunset.

The Little Things star said he was the 'love of her life' and showed off a gorgeous photo of her new 1.5-carat Mondial diamond white gold engagement ring.

'It has been a fairy tale': Jessica Mauboy has spoken about the breathtaking moment her construction worker fiance Themeli Magripilis proposed to her in Greece

Still dazed by the surprise, Jessica described the breathtaking moment to The Daily Telegraph.

'It was that moment of wow, that this was actually happening. I flashed back to all of our time together, he started to go red in the face and welled up in the eyes. That was it, I said yes and I cried,' she said.

Jessica first met her Themeli when she was 18-years-old while out dancing, and said he cares little about her celebrity status.

Good Different: The singer said her fiance's career in construction offered her some grounding to the real world

Her fiance couldn't be more different in his choice of career in construction, but the songstress said this has undoubtedly had a positive impact and allowed her to be grounded.

'I respect that and love that we don't share the same industry and we can come home into our safe zone and make it all about us in the moment, cooking, chilling and watching movies,' she said.

'It has been quite magical. It has been a fairytale for me. You want to spend the rest of your life with this person, doing all of the fun things, going through the ups and downs, doing what you love and being respected by it. That flashed through my head when he proposed.'

A Long Time Coming: Jessica first met her Themeli when she was 18-years-old while out dancing, and said he cares little about her celebrity status

And already, the singer is looking ahead to the couple's future, opening up about motherhood in an interview with WHO magazine.

She told the publication: 'Having kids and getting married is something I can visualise.'

The happy news comes after Jessica finally released new album Hilda on Friday, which is named after her late grandmother.

authors: Tom Place For Daily Mail Australia
